body.p: Previously paragraph 37(b) of IFRS 7 required an analysis of financial instruments that are individually determined to be credit-impaired as at the end of the reporting period, including an analysis of the factors that the entity considered when determining that those financial instruments are credit-impaired. Many entities already disclose the loan balance and loss allowance amount for both collectively and individually assessed credit-impaired loans. Consequently, the 2013 Impairment Exposure Draft proposed amendments to those requirements to limit them to financial instruments that an entity assesses individually for recognition of lifetime expected credit losses.
